creator: bhatia.sandip@gmail.com
text:
Hi,

We are upgrading our Apache web server server from 1.3.34 to 2.0.59 on AIX 5.3.

During the configure step we are getting the following error

=========./Configure Command=========
./configure --prefix=/app/apache/csd/csdcs --enable-mods-shared=most --
with-mpm=prefork --with-expat=buildin --with-port=1090 --verbose
====================================

=========./Configure Result=========
checking for default DBM... sdbm (default)
/sapinstall/httpd-2.0.59/srclib/apr-util/configure[25248]: buildin:
not found
checking for Expat in buildin... no
configure: error: Expat was not found (or recognized) in "buildin"
configure failed for srclib/apr-util
====================================

When we run the ./configure command without --with-expat=buildin, the
results are successful. Please let us know the use of Expat file and how can this be fixed.

Regards,
Sandeep

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
you have a typo; it is "builtin", not "buildin"

this is not a support forum; see http://httpd.apache.org/lists.html#http-users
